definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
lit. money will make the Devil turn millstones (idiom)/fig. with money, you can do anything you like
pinyin: you3 qian2 neng2 shi3 gui3 tui1 mo4

definition: to have money and time/to be part of the leisure class/the idle rich

sentences.english: You can tell the very rich by their evening dress.
sentences.chinese: 你可从夜礼服认出那些极有钱的富人。

sentences.english: Bourgeois houses only began to spring up there twenty-five years later.
sentences.chinese: 有钱人家的房屋直到二十五年前才开始在这里出现。

sentences.english: Money, eat in the restaurant Paofan.
sentences.chinese: 有钱的时候，在酒家吃泡饭。

sentences.english: Once he got rich,he flung aside his old freinds.
sentences.chinese: 他有钱后就立即抛弃了旧友。

sentences.english: Will donate money to, the brain will be fresh interest to study before karma.
sentences.chinese: 有钱要会布施，脑中才会清爽息念，才会消业障。

sentences.english: People “have got money in their hand if they’ve got a gift card,” Mr. Ullman said.
sentences.chinese: 人们“只要受到礼品卡就会有钱”Ullman说。

sentences.english: We didn't like him, as he always fawned on the rich.
sentences.chinese: 我们不喜欢他，因为他老是巴结有钱人。

sentences.english: Every year we gaze enviously at the lists of the richest people in world.
sentences.chinese: 每一年我们羡慕地盯着世界上最有钱的人名单。

sentences.english: Can somebody else be rich, this also isf quote?
sentences.chinese: 可人家就是有钱，这也是福报？

sentences.english: Many distant relatives fawned on the rich old man.
sentences.chinese: 远亲都来巴结这位有钱的老人。

sentences.english: In Chinese society very few fairy godmothers can be discovered.
sentences.chinese: 在中国社会里，很少有钱的女人慷慨捐助。

sentences.english: How should a person look like in order to be called handsome and rich?
sentences.chinese: 你认为真正又帅又有钱的人是什么样的？

sentences.english: To think rich oneself have to step to work dependably and on the spot.
sentences.chinese: 要想有钱就得自己踏踏实实地工作，。

sentences.english: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune must be in want of a wife.
sentences.chinese: 有钱的只身总要娶位太太，这是全球公认的真理。
佛斯特鲍特镇又有钱了。

sentences.english: This is the part of town where the well-to-do live.
sentences.chinese: 这地区住的全是镇上的有钱人家。

definition: poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
children of entrepreneurs who became wealthy under Deng Xiaoping's economic reforms in the 1980s/see also 窮二代|穷二代[qiong2 er4 dai4]
to have money and time/to be part of the leisure class/the idle rich
Fuyu county in Qiqihar 齊齊哈爾|齐齐哈尔[Qi2 qi2 ha1 er3], Heilongjiang
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
to parade one's wealth/to be ostentatious and extravagant
not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
